passage_text: Now that you’ve learned how to pick kale and a few facts about harvesting kale, you are ready to start your own nutritious crop. Kale is basically a cabbage type vegetable that does not form a head. Kale is tasty when cooked or kept small to use in salads. Kale has no serious disease problems. Harvest. Kale will be ready for harvest 55 days from transplanting, 70 to 80 days from seed. Cut individual leaves for use when the plant is 8 to 10 inches high; cut the outside leaves first. If you harvest the entire plant, cut 2 inches above the soil and the plant will sprout new leaves in 1 to 2 weeks. Harvest kale before it gets old and tough. Varieties.
